page.title: List of tallest buildings by U.S. state

revisions.rev:
The following is a '''list of the tallest buildings by [[U.S. state]]''', including the [[Washington, D.C.|District of Columbia]]. 40 of the buildings are in their respective states' largest city, and 18 are in their state's capital city. Two of them (the [[North Dakota State Capitol]] and the [[West Virginia State Capitol]]) serve as their respective states' seat of government. The height of the tallest building in the U.S. ([[Willis Tower]] in Chicago) is 1451 feet (442 m)âmore than the combined heights of the tallest buildings in Wyoming, Vermont, Maine, South Dakota, North Dakota, and Idaho. Many of the states' tallest buildings are attributed to banks: four to [[JPMorgan Chase]], three each to [[Bank of America]] and [[U.S. Bancorp]], and two for [[Wells Fargo]]. == Current tallest buildings == {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:left" |- ! Only continuous occupiable space is included. Non-freestanding structures, observational towers, and communication towers are excluded (North Dakota boasts the [[KVLY-TV mast|largest guyed mast structure]] in the world), as are antennae extending from the structure top. For more information, see [[Tallest building|building heights]]. ==See also== *[[List of tallest buildings in the United States]] *[[List of tallest buildings in the world]] ==Notes== :'''A.'''{{note label|note01|A|^}}City is here defined by the broader definition of urbanized area. See [[urban area]] for more information. :'''B.'''{{note label|note02|B|^}}Year completed :'''C.'''{{note label|note03|C|^}}Previously named the Bank One Center. :'''D.'''{{note label|note04|D|^}}The Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception, also in Portland, is a taller structure, but not inhabited at the higher levels, and therefore does not fit the criteria for tallest buildings.{{cite web |url=http://www.emporis.com/en/wm/ci/bu/?id=101732 |title= Portland Maine building heights |accessdate=2007-07-25 |work=www.emporis.com}} :'''E.'''{{note label|note05|E|^}}The [[Stratosphere Tower]] is the largest tower in Nevada and west of the Mississippi River in the United States. However, because the structure is not fully habitable, it is excluded from this list. Please see the [[List of tallest buildings by U.S. state#Methodology|Methodology]] for further information. :'''F.'''{{note label|note06|F|^}}Previously held by the [[Zip Feed Mill]] until its demolition in 2005. Qwest Tower is currently uncertified, and some dispute has been noted suggesting St. Joseph's Cathedral (also in Sioux Falls) may actually be taller.{{cite web |url=http://www.emporis.com/en/wm/ci/bu/?id=10273|title=South Dakota building comparison|accessdate=2007-07-18 |work=www.emporis.com}} ==References== {{reflist|2}} {{US tallest buildings lists}} {{TBSW}} {{USStateLists}} [[Category:Buildings and structures in the United States by state| ]] [[Category:Lists of tallest buildings in the United States| ]] [[Category:Skyscrapers in the United States| ]] [[cs:Seznam nejvyÅ¡Å¡Ã­ch budov podle stÃ¡tÅ¯ USA]] [[sk:Zoznam najvyÅ¡Å¡Ã­ch budov USA]]
